standard_metadata.standard_description: Use informal arguments to establish facts about the angle sum and exterior angle of triangles, about the angles created when parallel lines are cut by a transversal, and the angle-angle criterion for similarity of triangles.

question.content: Below are two parallel lines with a third line intersecting them.      $x =$  $^\circ$

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the top, left angle measure is x degrees. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the top, left angle measure is 116 degrees.

hints.content: Notice that the two angles are in the same position but at different intersections.
One way to describe the angles is to say that they are corresponding angles.  Corresponding angles are always equal.
Angle $x$ is $116^\circ$.     [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the top, left angle measure is 116 degrees. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the top, left angle measure is 116 degrees.

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the bottom, right most angle measure is x degrees. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the top, right most angle measure is 46 degrees.

hints.content: The pink angles are adjacent to the blue angle and form a straight line, so they measure:   $\qquad180^\circ - 46^\circ = 134^\circ$    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the top parallel line, the bottom, right most angle measure is x degrees. Where the third line crosses the bottom parallel line, the top, right most angle measure is 46 degrees, the top, left angle measure is 134 degrees, and the bottom, right most angle measure is 134 degrees.

hints.content: The pink angles are equal because they are opposite each other.
One of the pink angles corresponds with the green angle, and the other pink angle forms an alternate interior angle.
Angle $x$ equals the pink angles and measures $134^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]   Note that the blue and green angles are supplementary.

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the left angle measure is x degrees. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top angle measure is 89 degrees, the left angle measure is 91 degrees, and the right most angle measure is 91 degrees.

hints.content: The pink angles are equal because they are vertical angles.
One of the pink angles corresponds with the green angle, and the other pink angle forms an alternate exterior angle.
Angle $x$ equals the pink angles and measures $91^\circ$.   [[☃ image 1]]   Note that the blue and green angles are supplementary.

images.alt: Two parallel lines with a third line intersecting each line. Where the third line crosses the left most parallel line, the left angle measure is 91 degrees. Where the third line crosses the right most parallel line, the top angle measure is 89 degrees, the left angle measure is 91 degrees, and the right most angle measure is 91 degrees.
